topic.name: Eurasian and African Empires
topic.description: 13-year academic progression (K-12) for Eurasian and African Empires in History & Social Studies

objectives.objective_text: Identify Africa as a place with rich kings.
Name Mansa Musa as the richest man ever.
Identify the Swahili Coast (trading cities).
Identify cities in the jungle and mountains.
Name the Aztecs and Incas.
Identify Machu Picchu.

objectives.sub_topic_name: East Asia: Sui, Tang, Song, Ming
objectives.objective_text: Identify China as a land of invention.

objectives.sub_topic_name: East Asia: Sui, Tang, Song, Ming
objectives.objective_text: Name fireworks and paper as Chinese inventions.

objectives.sub_topic_name: East Asia: Sui, Tang, Song, Ming
objectives.objective_text: Identify the Forbidden City.
Identify India as a land of spices.
Name elephants used in war.
Identify the Indian Ocean trade.
Identify Mongols as horse riders.
Name Genghis Khan as a powerful leader.
Identify Marco Polo.
Recall that they had gold and salt.
Observe the mud mosques of Timbuktu.
Recall that they built pyramids and roads without wheels.
Observe llama wool and gold art.

objectives.sub_topic_name: East Asia: Sui, Tang, Song, Ming
objectives.objective_text: Recall the Great Wall.

objectives.sub_topic_name: East Asia: Sui, Tang, Song, Ming
objectives.objective_text: Observe beautiful Chinese painting.
Recall that new rulers came with a new religion.
Recall that they conquered a huge land.
Observe yurts (tents).
Summarize the Gold-Salt trade.
Explain why Timbuktu was a center of learning.
Explain the wealth of the African empires.
Defend the existence of advanced civilization in pre-colonial Africa.
Summarize the floating gardens of the Aztecs.
Explain the Inca road system in the mountains.
Explain the Quipu (knot recording system).
Defend the agricultural innovation of these cultures.

objectives.sub_topic_name: East Asia: Sui, Tang, Song, Ming
objectives.objective_text: Summarize the Golden Age of the Tang Dynasty.

objectives.sub_topic_name: East Asia: Sui, Tang, Song, Ming
objectives.objective_text: Explain the Civil Service Exam (studying to be a leader).

objectives.sub_topic_name: East Asia: Sui, Tang, Song, Ming
objectives.objective_text: Explain the tribute system.

objectives.sub_topic_name: East Asia: Sui, Tang, Song, Ming
objectives.objective_text: Defend the continuity of Confucian bureaucracy.
Summarize the arrival of Islam in India.
Explain the mix of Hindu and Muslim culture.
Explain the resistance of the southern kingdoms.
Defend the cultural richness of the Indo-Islamic fusion.
Summarize how the Mongols fought.
Explain the Pax Mongolica (peace for trade).
Explain the fragmentation into Khanates.
Defend the impact of the Mongols on world history.
Compare the Kingdom of Mali with Ghana.
Analyze the spread of Islam into West Africa.
Interpret the oral history of the Griots.
Connect Great Zimbabwe to Indian Ocean trade.
Compare Tenochtitlan (Aztec city) with European cities.
Interpret the role of human sacrifice in Aztec religion.
Connect the lack of iron/horses to their isolation.

objectives.sub_topic_name: East Asia: Sui, Tang, Song, Ming
objectives.objective_text: Compare the voyages of Zheng He with Columbus.

objectives.sub_topic_name: East Asia: Sui, Tang, Song, Ming
objectives.objective_text: Analyze the impact of Woodblock Printing.

objectives.sub_topic_name: East Asia: Sui, Tang, Song, Ming
objectives.objective_text: Interpret the isolationist policy of the Ming Dynasty.

objectives.sub_topic_name: East Asia: Sui, Tang, Song, Ming
objectives.objective_text: Connect the Grand Canal to trade.
Observe patterns in Indian architecture.
Compare a Sultan with a Raja.
Analyze the conflict and synthesis of Hinduism and Islam.
Connect the monsoon winds to trade patterns.
Compare Kublai Khan (ruled China) with Genghis Khan.
Analyze the military tactics (speed, feigned retreat).
Interpret the religious tolerance of the Mongols.
Connect the Silk Road safety to the Black Death spread.
Evaluate the sophistication of African political structures.
Evaluate the vulnerability of these empires to disease.

objectives.sub_topic_name: East Asia: Sui, Tang, Song, Ming
objectives.objective_text: Evaluate the technological superiority of China in the Middle Ages.
Evaluate the treatment of non-Muslims (dhimmis) in India.
Evaluate the 'barbarian' stereotype vs. administrative skill.
Construct a profile of Mansa Musa's Hajj.
Synthesize the integration of Africa into the medieval global economy.
Analyze the engineering feats (aqueducts, masonry).
Construct a comparison of Aztec and Inca administration.
Synthesize the structure of these empires before Spanish contact.

objectives.sub_topic_name: East Asia: Sui, Tang, Song, Ming
objectives.objective_text: Construct a timeline of Chinese Dynasties.

objectives.sub_topic_name: East Asia: Sui, Tang, Song, Ming
objectives.objective_text: Synthesize the cultural flourishing of the Song Dynasty.
Interpret the architecture of the Qutub Minar.
Construct a history of the Delhi Sultanate's dynasties.
Synthesize the prelude to the Mughal Empire.
Construct a map of the Mongol Empire's extent.
Synthesize the Yuan Dynasty's rule in China.
